metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3423 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: lisp/net/browse-url.el in GNU Emacs 24.3 and earlier allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a /tmp/Mosaic.##### temporary file.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Mosiac hard-coded this pid file name, the alternative is dropping support for Mosiac entirely. Don't be hasty. leosilva> from emacs, they added this line only http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/emacs-diffs/2014-05/msg00057.html not-fixed

criterions.comment: emacs23: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
emacs24: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xemacs21-packages: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
